website_summaries.verdict: Though there are cheaper fixed-gear bikes out there, this one is one of the best values.
pros: This 6KU fixie is great for beginners
Parts are standard and easily upgraded
The rear wheel is reversible for fixed gear or single-speed riding
Components are generally of high quality
Available in five sizes and five colors
At 19 to 20 pounds, this is a lighter bike
cons: The brake pads are of low quality and may damage the paint on the rims

website_summaries.verdict: This is an excellent choice for those looking for an extremely lightweight and portable fixed gear bike.
pros: Aluminum frame offers buyers  an especially light bike – around 20 pounds for many of the sizes
Front and back brakes are removable
Seat is comfortable enough for most riders
cons: Difficult to mount a water bottle

customer_reviews.title: Fun bike to zip around with
customer_reviews.text: I love the bike for the pricepoint. It's light, looks great, and it's fast. The brakes grab pretty good. I would recommend ordering direct from 6ku though. I will say be careful with the paint, it seems to scratch easily. I ordered through Amazon for the ease of payment being a prime member, and also a prime rewards member. However the box arrived pretty beat up and the from rim was damaged. Amazon of course took care of the problem for me, but my options were either return the whole bike or take a %25 refund. Had I ordered through 6ku I could have just gotten the wheel replaced.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but....
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is really fast, light, comfortable, and good looking. I have to agree that the pedals are just crap, brakes are OK can use better pads, and there is no mounting holes for a water bottle, but those are very simple fixes. Mine came with the bullhorn which is the best look for single speed/ fix bikes in my opinion. I highly recommend this bike but, do order some good pedals. Besides the little things, I do give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JoeIT

customer_reviews.title: Best weight-to-cost ratio in this price range!
customer_reviews.text: For the money.... Unbelievable. I fell in love with this bike as soon as I assembled it. Yeah yeah, some of the parts seem a little cheap, but the frame is awesome. I eventually want to add parts here and there, and do upgrades over time, like I have done with other bikes in the past. So this bike is perfect for what I wanted. One of the lightest frames you can get for the money. I did my hw before I decided to buy. Other bikes in this $ range are on average 10 lbs heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Seth D. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price at all!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, it's a cool-looking bike, but it's not worth the price tag at all. This is pretty much a glorified Walmart tier bike. It feels cheap. There is absolutely nothing about this bike that justifies spending over $200. I really regret buying it. It also came scratched up out of the box. I don't expect it to hold up for very long. Don't be fooled by the trendy description like I was.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different bike
customer_reviews.text: How does this have such high ratings? The bike has no adjustable speed, the seat is so uncomfortable the area between my testicles and buttocks was swollen, the tires are extremely weak and susceptible to popping over the smallest things, the pedals are not at all durable (they literally cracked the 3rd time i used the bike and I weigh 170 pounds). The problems are endless and the price certainly not worth it. I wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Arber

customer_reviews.title: Value commuter bike - Light as a feather!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, looks comparable to bikes that price for double and it has GREAT breaks. This fixie can not be beat for the price. If you aren't a serious cyclist and just need a solid bike to cruise around town or get to work than this is for you. After using Citi bike for years this bike is light that it feels pretty much effortless. A huge feature is the ability to have the rear wheel in "Freewheel" so its not a straight fixie and you can cruise.
customer_reviews.author: Greg D

customer_reviews.title: Bought mainly for that Bianchi color (Celeste)
customer_reviews.text: It's heavy for an alloy bike. Torque the axles and check because they came loose on me (rear one turned and stuck against stay under load and front one almost fell off crossing road w/ traffic). Tip of the seat bends under moderate pressure. Cheap pedals (but that's a plus to those of us who like to switch those out knowing a whole bike is much cheaper than the components alone. Break pads came poorly aligned but was easy to fix w/o using a toe strap or third hand tool. Brake cable wears at paint on head tube. Bearings came perfectly tensioned. Will want to pump tires every 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: matt benedict

customer_reviews.title: Good simple bike, extremely lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I’m not too familiar with bikes and what’s “good” but I love this bike for the most part. I’ve had it for almost a year commuting here and there on a short ride to work. I’m 5’2.5” and purchased the XS but it’s still a little too tall for me, I have a hard time getting off sometimes The tires don’t seem to hold consistent air though, every few rides I get a flat and I have to fill it up. I’d suggest getting better quality tires for the convenience. The bike is EXTREMELY lightweight, again, I’m 5’2” of average build and I could easily pick up and bring down the bike from my apartment stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Christina M

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: Assembly and initial maintenance of this bike takes some know-how. Intermediate difficulty. If you don't know how to true wheels, take it to a professional before use. The rear tire was put on with the tread the wrong direction and both wheels were out of true (presumably from shipping). It's sturdy and quick. And looks nice. I would totally buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Lo-Lo

customer_reviews.title: Sweet ride!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a former bike mechanic so getting a factory assembled (all prices out toghether, not necessarily adjusted) bike is no problem. Wheels are true and headset was perfect. I’d guess you should plan on about $100 more for bike shop assembly, a U lock, some little lights. I also spent $60 on some German fenders. Now it’s a perfect commuter bike!!!
customer_reviews.author: Whale Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad  :)
customer_reviews.text: AVANT sent me my first bike and during the assembly I found that the front wheel was rubbing the main body frame (couldn't turn the wheel to the left nor right) not sure but maybe the frame was bent incorrectly but I returned it and then requested a second bike. Getting the second bike was a quick turnaround. . "Customer Service gets a A+" As for the bike, this will be my first fixed gear bike and I must say, I truly love it. For the price, I would recommend this bike to every cyclists looking to just cruise. In time, I will pass this on to a family member then come back for a upgraded model.. Regards - Dan
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: The Aluminum frame shows good welds and the rest of the parts are good
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely stellar display of simplicity in biking combined with price. The Aluminum frame shows good welds and the rest of the parts are good, and if not, cheaply upgradable. I did opt for a set of aluminum pegs when I ordered with reviews negatively effecting the plastic ones which accompany the bike. Previously having owned several downhill mountain bikes reaching well into the several k range, I was pleasantly surprised to receive such a high quality item at the price. I am only starting the 'road' and 'fixed' world, but do I need any more at present? Absolutely not. Also the price makes me not worry if I leave it in the back of my truck unattended!
customer_reviews.author: Philip Kaufmann

customer_reviews.title: Fix the shipping box and risk for buyers will be very low
customer_reviews.text: Nice bike. Packaging not so good. Front wheel bent but just got it fixed. Gear ratio is quite high, They should offer a few ratios. Frame is tight, your toes will hit front wheel when turning at slow speed. Bike finish and components top notch. Seat is quite comfy. You feel fast on this bike - if the shipping box was better, it would have been five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: A super bike for a good price!!
customer_reviews.text: A super bike for a good price. The aluminum frame makes a world of difference in comfort, ride, and ease of transport. I use it as my daily commuter bike and ride in a relatively flat town and at the end of the day haul it up three flights to my apartment. Compared to my prior steel fixie (stolen) it rides better and is faster. I flipped the hub and removed the brakes but you can ride it as a conventional freewheeling bike if that works for you. Not a good choice for trails or big hills.
customer_reviews.author: Snowdolfin

customer_reviews.title: Great bike I'm only on day two I'm pretty heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bike I'm only on day two I'm pretty heavy guy about 240 and I put about 60 miles on it the last two days although it's a road bike mostly it handles good in dirt as long as it's hard wheels I got came perfectly trued.. and they are still good after after best it up for 2 days so far very happy the seat is very uncomfortable so I swapped that out but great bike super light and perfect gear ratio you can hit high speeds it's the fastest starter but who cares
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our son to take to college. My husband and I put it together in about an hour. The only problem we had was the chain.....it's too long. We tried to set the rear wheel further back in the fork, but it never stayed. so the chain constantly came off. We took it to a bike shop and had the chain professionally fit, and it works great now. For the price, this is a great bike. My son is 6'3" and the XL frame fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: jrunner

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bike for the price. I've put about 300 miles on this bike commuting through downtown Boston. It's light fast and fun to ride. The frame is responsive and durable. It's a perfectly stiff ride for sprinting lights. Pros: Light Decent rims, easy to true Front and rear brakes Easy assembly, if you're mechanically inclined Cons: Seat is terrible Brake pads are a little weak New model is flat bars ( mine had bullhorns)
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It’s a bike !
customer_reviews.text: It’s very hard to find a decent bike that do not cost an arm and a leg these day. This bike fits my price range and is in good quality. Assemble is a bit tricky and took about 30 mins. It sits high so measure carefully and if you are between sizes, go down. It does not come with air so note that you will need to give the wheel air before taking it out for a ride.
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: You're paying for the frame
customer_reviews.text: Box arrived with a fist sized hole in the center of it and rear axle protruding out. Luckily no damage to axle but slight 3/4 inch scuff mark on rear rim which black sharpie took care of. Front hub slightly over tightened but rear hub severely over tightened. I echo other's comments on the cheap saddle and pedals. I don't have a problem with the brakes like other's have had. Front wheel true but rear wheel not so much. Light and fast due to aluminum frame. These are only initial comments because of limited time behind wheel. Overall, satisfied with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Young

customer_reviews.title: good beginner fixed gear bike
customer_reviews.text: great frame and paint ... the parts your gonna have to change out if you want to have a decent ride ...gear ratio is for a beginner cyclist ...aka slow.. for the price its great for a frame and fork ....and ive only been riding the stock parts for a week in normal city conditions so far I need to change front bracket, pedals, handle bar, (just not my preference) rear cog and probly the chainset just to get some decent speed so I can ride in the ride safe in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bike
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bike. It is comfortable and responsive. I am used to road bikes so the stock handlebars weren't super comfortable for me. There is nothing wrong with them, it's just a matter of preference. I ended up getting the Fyxation Rodeo Pursuit style bars which fit great. Note: there are no mounting holes for a bottle cage so if thats important you'd have to tap your own
customer_reviews.author: Berge472

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for a great price. 52cm fit me perfect. I'm 5'9 145lb. sizes run big compared to most bikes. Loving the bike so far. Bike does not come with built in screws for water bottle cage keep in mind. But an easy solution is to just buy the Velcro strap as shown in my picture. Front brake is a little long, 10 dollars at your local bike shop quick fix
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a light weight simple fun well made bike. Oh and not too expensive. This fit the bill to a tee. I rode it today 13 miles and loved it. It was smooth, efficient fun bike. Awesome affordable fun bike. Totally recommend this bike. Oh it shipped really quick too. Still smiling....
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Happy teenagers
customer_reviews.text: Son loves this bike best bike ever from the mouth of a 17 year old then friends seen bike and bought the same bike so now it's a total of six happy teenagers riding around.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bring your own pedals
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bike for the price but some of the parts are noticeably cheap, the assembly instructions are most likely not for the bike you ordered, and I had a pedal break off in the crank shaft after less than 2 weeks of riding it, requiring me to purchase a new crank shaft system at full price from the company.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Novak

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: I got the bike with a dent on one of the pipes, but other than that, it was in great condition. It took a few hours to assemble it by myself since I've never assembled something like this before but it wasn't too bad to put together! I've taken it on rides around a few lakes and to get around the city and so far, it's been great! I'm 5'1" and got the smallest size bike which is slightly too big for me, but I can stand over the bike frame with about 0.5 inch clearance.
customer_reviews.author: Manasa

customer_reviews.title: ... I only got it yesterday but only because I love the Design and Color
customer_reviews.text: First of all I'm giving it five stars and I only got it yesterday but only because I love the Design and Color. It should be displayed in MOMA. To be honest I haven't been able to adjust the brakes yet and it comes without a kickstand but I love this bike. It is also very light. I easily lift it with one arm without too much effort on my part. I'm glad I found it on Amazon thought I did a lot of searching. 6KU does not show up in bicycle searches. I don't even know ( or remember) how I found it.
customer_reviews.author: stefan vladescu

customer_reviews.title: Good bike
customer_reviews.text: I've owned for 2 months now... Great bang for your buck, minor adjustments/tweaks will be needed but that's a given. Bike was easy to assemble (20 minutes and this was the 1st time I ever assembled a bike). Rides great and what you'd expect at this price point. Had to re-adjust the the brakes after a few days of use but no other issues. Getting one for my wife too.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am loving this bike! It is lightweight, fast, and responsive. I’ve put about 100 miles on it since I got it two weeks ago, and it feels really solid so far. I did make a few upgrades right out of the box - pedals and straps (a must if you’re riding fixed), a more comfortable seat, and a rainbow chain (purely aesthetic). ;) May switch out the risers for some bullhorns at some point, but the geometry is plenty comfortable for the riding I do as-is. I am 5’6” and purchased the 52cm and it fits me very well. Looking forward to really putting it to the test this summer!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coyle

customer_reviews.title: aluminum frame
customer_reviews.text: The box was damaged , however , l think it was ups and not the company's fault. The product ( bike ) seem fine. It was fairly easy to assemble but the front brake seems to give me a little trouble. I am going to upgrade the pedals, the brakes, and handlebars anyway. l really love the aluminum frame . Most companies don't give you that option.
customer_reviews.author: MATTHEW  E  PELZER  III

customer_reviews.title: Bottom Bracket noise
customer_reviews.text: I've put about 20 miles on the bike so far and I enjoy it. It handles great, its very light weight and it looks great. The reason for the 4 stars is because it has a noise coming from the bottom bracket which I assume will need changing soon. For the price it's a good deal but I was hoping the bottom bracket would of lasted a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: AIDA

customer_reviews.title: i need a new crank set in less then three weeks
customer_reviews.text: ive only have hate it less then three weeks an the crank arm where the peddle holes is stripped no groves the peddle just falls out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, decent bike
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived in a box and it was easy to put together by someone who had never put a bike together before. Rides well, the only complaint I have is after about a week of riding, the tire went flat. I don't know if this is a defect in the tire, or something that was ridden over caused this. But otherwise, after advising my son not to buy something like this on Amazon, he went ahead and ordered it, and he has successfully proved me wrong. It has been a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Super trooper

customer_reviews.title: 1000+ miles later...
customer_reviews.text: This has been my daily commuter for about 6 months (8 miles a day) and I couldn't be happier with the bike. I've ridden it with stock parts except for replacing the brakes and tubes over time. Super quiet, super light, and handles hills relatively well. Hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this bike as my first fixed gear to get off my old bike that I found and converted for free off a tree lawn. Can't beat this bike for the price, I tore the brakes off and flipped the wheel first thing and the bike rides great. It is unbelievably light coming off of my old chromoly bike. I also picked up some of the 6ku foot straps to top it off, I would recommend these to others as well. The only thing that I did not like was the grips that game on it, they look and feel weird. So a trashed them before the first ride and tore some grips off my old bmx bike.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Fast bike and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with the quality and how fast it is... If you're looking for an affordable good looking bike, this is it. I get compliments on it all the time and people are shocked when I tell them how much I paid for it. Been riding this one for a year now and still rides great. I replaced the crank, chain wheel and pedals, and put some gatorskin tires on it, but I have friends who've paid over a thousand dollars for bikes that are just as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin W. Morris

customer_reviews.title: don't forget to tighten the sprocket
customer_reviews.text: I discovered some dents and some marrs on the seat tube, and noticed some of the spokes were loose, and the chainring was slightly crooked. Other than that, its a great looking bike! The box was smaller than I thought. Super easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Rickie

customer_reviews.title: A bike great for beginners!!!
customer_reviews.text: i am 5’7 with 30 inseam: 52cm bike This bike is mainly for commuting. After putting at least 30 miles on this, it runs smooth , it’s very light , and a decent amount of speed for a bike this price. The seat is uncomfortable so I just added on a gel seat cover. The matte on the bike can easily be scratched off. However, there are a lot of upgrades in the future with this bike such as handlebars, pedals, tires and so forth. Overall an above average bike for the price it is. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: perfect little peddler
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of using it to haul my pup in a buggy and it works perfectly. it took me about 30 minutes to assemble; it's lightweight; stylish and perfect for the pricepoint. best of all, it delivers right to your doorstep -- thank you Amazon. the only qualm i have it pumping the tires to 100 psi -- its really hard to get there.
customer_reviews.author: Mar

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty easy to assemble, the pedals are cheap, seat also. I will be l replcing thoe and the bars. Maybe convert it into drop bars if you’re looking to commute get it, if not i consider getting a road bike for long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Pina

customer_reviews.title: the lightest bike
customer_reviews.text: I did change out the seat and handle bars....other than that the bike rides nice....has to be ridden on road....skinny tires not made for pavers or cracks bumps in the road
customer_reviews.author: John Z

customer_reviews.title: Great fixie
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. I never owned a fixie before until this one. The bike rides great, smooth ride, would recommend keeping a small pump on hand and pump up the tires once a week to keep them in the best riding condition. Get compliments all the time on it.
customer_reviews.author: Marek Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Tiffany blue
customer_reviews.text: Love the color I’m waiting to customize it seats and Handel bars then I’ll be happy happy I’m 6ft 340 so I’m quite rough on it unintentionally I just ordered gator skin tires cause I keep getting flats
customer_reviews.author: sephen jadon

customer_reviews.title: It wasn't good quality.
customer_reviews.text: there is no quality. It was the awful bike. When I ride a bike, The pedal was broken. I can't believe that. I read many recommendations before buying, however, It wasn't good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Talha

customer_reviews.title: Very good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very very light weight. I took it to professional and paid $50 to get it assembled because I couldn’t do it myself. Definitely sleek and looks really good
customer_reviews.author: Buying Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick Setup!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic bike! One thing I really like about it is that it’s super easy to set up out of the box and comes with all the tools you need! You’ll be riding within a couple hours. Brakes come assembled which is a big plus, no wire cutting or additional time setting up the brakes just calibrate and go. I’m about 6’1” and got the large 58cm and it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for the price. Did a bunch of upgrading including handlebars, stem, tire, seat, rear wheel changed to coaster, chain, chainring. Cheap stock components all around, but if you need a working bike and want to upgrade slowly...this is your best bet. If I were to do it again I would build a frame from scratch. Great beginner bike. Rides harsh and stiff. The fork is way too stiff but I bought carbon handlebars which helped. Planning to get a steel frame from cinelli, wabi, or all-city. This was a fun cheap entry level bike to experiment on. No regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Kai

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike, great price, good upgrade potential.
customer_reviews.text: So far its been a great bike for the price. I've put about 200mi on it so far and haven't had any issues. Bought it to get back into riding and the simplicity and cost of a single speed/fixed bike appealed to me. Aside from swapping out the handle bars to a set of pursuit bars and a Selle Italia saddle I had laying around its going to stay stock until the wheels are ready for an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You don’t even get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Broke on third ride. Pedal came completely off. Stripped. Had to push bike home in a rain storm. Bike sucks, you get what you pay for. Luckily I was able to return it. Pain in the a** to do so, but at least I got my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Jason s.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a college student who doesn’t own a vehicle, I could ride bus but I figured having my own bike will help with time management more efficiently. I was on a $200 budget but most bikes at that price range had more bad reviews than this one. Overall, bike is great, very easy assemble (I assembled myself). :) Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: John Tuq

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: It took me 20-30 mins to assemble the bike. Quality is great. Light weight. This bike is a canvas. I was able to customize it a little bit!!! Not changing any parts for now. Will be ordering 3 aditional bikes for the kids and wife.
customer_reviews.author: Raul

customer_reviews.title: Quality control is shoddy
customer_reviews.text: The bike looks really nice and has a great ride. No question about it, there’s great value for the money. My gripe is the quality assurance. The rim tape that came inside of the tires was too narrow for the track of the rim and the tube was punctured. Really wanted to love everything about this, but fixing this issue cost me more $30. That’s 1/8 of what the bike costs.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia

customer_reviews.title: Comparable to bikes THREE TIMES the cost of this gem!
customer_reviews.text: By FaR the best bang for your buck if you want a nice, agile, quick and light commuter bike. Very clean look, With professionally done weld lines. I especially like the option of switching between single-speed hub for the long rides, or fixed-gear when I want to put in the extra leg-work. Seller quickly shipped out my order and was available for any questions I had. I seriously love this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ukulai

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, easy assembly, light weight. Ive had it for one day, it arrived with a few scratches on the paint but other than that i am happy with this bike.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rosics

customer_reviews.title: Very decent bike for only $250
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike. After a lot of reasearch and thought, i decided to go with the 6ku urban track. Very glad i did. Good solid build and light as can be. Def cant beat it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great quality on a budget. Lightweight, easy to assemble and comfortable to ride
customer_reviews.author: Everard D'costa

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected, exceptional value..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike for my daily lunch ride. Great value, good geometry set up was a breeze. The only thing I would change is to add quick release hubs just in case of an on road flat.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Gennaro

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase I made this month.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike, very happy. Not heavy, nice geometry, and exactly as advertised. Make sure you have a bike toolkit - requires a bit of assembly. Only thing less than perfect is the wheels breaking surfaces are a little rumbly, but, hey, it's not a $10,000 bike! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome straight out of the box. I’ve bought 2 so far and love them both. The first one was a large which at 6’ was too big so I bought a medium. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Win win win
customer_reviews.text: Amazing aluminium frame. Awesome bang for the buck. Light weight and smooth riding. I dont think i have anything negative to write about this purchase.. Would recomend to anybody for a badass fixie
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Extremely light weight
customer_reviews.text: This bike is great! It's extremely light weight, less than 20 lbs. The only flaw is that it can't go through gravel. It's not a mountain bike, so it makes sense it can't handle excess gravel. Overall it's great. It rides smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, Great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! Very light weight. Comfortable. Assembly was very easy, but recommend a bike rack or second set of hands to make it even easier.
customer_reviews.author: jamoreno42

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great bike. wife loves it! had a issue but amazon made it right! thanks!
customer_reviews.author: MichaeldoesMichael

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good bike for the price. No real complaints. For serious bike enthusiasts you may want to invest in something higher quality. Otherwise, this bike does exactly what is advertised. No real issues. Nice for my short commute.
customer_reviews.author: C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, light and durable
customer_reviews.text: You just need hex wrenches to assemble. I love this bike, got another one after the first one was stolen from me
customer_reviews.author: marilu

customer_reviews.title: Keeps breaking.
customer_reviews.text: Awful bike. The fixed gear cog keeps on breaking. The pedals tripped the throne of the crank. Repairing the broken parts costed me an estra $100. Do not buy this bike. Invest in a better quality one.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike. The seat is no more comfortable than any other seat that I've ridden, but I love everything about the bike. Easy to assemble, as well.
customer_reviews.author: michael stone

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Came with assembly instructions for a totally different bike. Isn’t very structurally sound (seat falls all the way down every bump in the road). Front tire hits your toes when you turn. Gave it +1 for the aesthetic, but pretty frustrating as for setup and rideability.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Its a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'7 220 lbs. The 52cm is a perfect fit for me. This bike is very nice out of the box. Very light with a good high-end looking finish. No name hardware but well made for the most part. I immediately changed my pedals and upgraded my brake pads. I find the mounting position for the brake handles to be a bit awkward but that's personal preference. They take care to package it well for shipping. It's by far the best quality in its price range. Completely upgradable. Oh and there are no mounting holes for a water bottle cage. You'll have to use straps.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Avila

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, no nonsense bike - great value
customer_reviews.text: I use this bike for my commuter and have put about 100+ miles so far. It’s a sturdy, no nonsense bike. It’s a great value for the $$$, but you may want to make some upgrades. I changed out the seat for a more comfortable version. Also changed out handlebars to bullhorn. So far I’m pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Samuel R Bugg

customer_reviews.title: The quality on this bike is amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: The quality on this bike is amazing for the price. It is replacing my former bike that cost $100 more that needed components replaced out of the box.. The welds are smooth and everything is working well. I have ridden it more than 1200 miles in the first 3 months and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check product
customer_reviews.text: Product came in 2 days ago. Just started riding it today and The front tire is slowly losing air. Product did not come with extra tire tubes and due to the fact of riding it with a flat tire. It damaged the bike wheel. But overall it’s a great bike for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael calma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Price for a Perfect Ride
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bike for quite some time, and have really loved it. The bike was very simple to put together. I have ridden it more than 1000 miles and it has still not even needed a tire change. I use this bike to ride to and from work which is 5 miles each way and on 25 mile exercise rides. Everything is perfect about this bike, minus the seat. I find it uncomfortable, but you can always replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Bad crank
customer_reviews.text: So we bought the bike about a week ago and almost immediately crank arm started pulling off We had to buy a new one from the bikes or cost me 30 bucks
customer_reviews.author: bob lew

customer_reviews.title: This SS/FG bike is great.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bike that was light, nothing fancy, and inexpensive. This product meets what I was looking for in a bike for a minus $300 budget.
customer_reviews.author: iBecamed

customer_reviews.title: Best entry level bike
customer_reviews.text: I've had multiple of these bikes as I travel a lot and it's not possible for me to take my bike with me all the time and this makes an awesome beater for the price paid. It has a nice geometry and it's easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Really great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bike! The only thing i dont like is it says "6KU" all over it. These logos are clear coated on top off and can not be removed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bike. Super happy with it, was riding after 30 minutes, ease of assembly, now just need to get the quick release skewer for the front wheel..
customer_reviews.author: loiro

customer_reviews.title: Great first bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great first fixed gear bike in my opinion nothing wrong so far just be sure to tighten everything Especially the crank because if you put pressure peddling the reverse way like when you try to skid my crank starts to get loose but easy to fix just tighten
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light. Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect too much from this bike and have been hugely impressed with it, given the price. Great light bike, put a set of 28mm GP4000s on it for comfort and it's a killer ride. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andy Turley

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Super hard to pedal especially up hill. Bike feels cheap too
customer_reviews.author: Jeremye Scott

customer_reviews.title: I actually like the bike very much
customer_reviews.text: I actually like the bike very much. The reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is the fact that I had to remove the front wheel breaks. For some reason the metal frame that holds the brake pads were coming into contact right on top of the wheel, causing it not to turn. That's the only issue I had, other than that the bike is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Macedo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The bike was perfect and it rides great the assembly was pretty simple if you have the right tools
customer_reviews.author: ayalexander

customer_reviews.title: light, sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: I put the bike together myself and was impressed by the design and the quality of the bike. It is super light. The color, the shape and the efficient design make this bike a moving, usesable piece of art. Thanks for making such a beautiful, easy to ride bike so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Nai

customer_reviews.title: Nice frame, junk components
customer_reviews.text: Nice frame, junk components. Returning. For about $150 more you can get a Giant Escape. I wish I had never ordered this.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Nicklin

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I put some bullhorns on and changed out the brake levers and cables. This is a good quality bike. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: JMat

customer_reviews.title: Pedal and wheel fell off while biking
customer_reviews.text: Pedal fell apart, wheel popped on a separate occasion. This was within first week use.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike.
customer_reviews.text: I use this in downtown Raleigh to deliver sandwiches every day. It is really lightweight and upgradable with lights and other accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this. It was one of the few fixed gear bikes I could find in such a small size to suit a very short rider.
customer_reviews.author: videogameguy2

customer_reviews.title: is very light and the gear ratio is quite comfortable. It's great if you want something to start ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike has performed above expectations, is very light and the gear ratio is quite comfortable. It's great if you want something to start biking or a small 5-10 mile commute.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, light and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: great quality, I ride it everyday. Seriously good bang for your buck. Super light and quick bike!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike for the money the matte black thick frame ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike for the money the matte black thick frame is very aesthetically pleasing when paired with 60mm wheels. I replaced the brake pads with koolstop Duo, upgraded to Bullhorn handlebars with sRam bar tape, fyxation bar and caps, VP blue anodized pedals, gatorskin tires. The bottom bracket is making some noise I plan to upgrade that to a Shimano un55 and get a larger 52t chain ring.
customer_reviews.author: Garrit Visser

customer_reviews.title: Bike details
customer_reviews.text: Dont know alot about bikes but , this bike pretty decent quality for someone who isn't looking to spend alot. Been riding it for a day now, gotta say it's pretty smooth , duration up hills a little rough but it's ok, eventually I'll change all the parts to make it better , in 3 months we will see how it holds up
customer_reviews.author: Shechem

customer_reviews.title: 6KU urban track bike
customer_reviews.text: Great single speed/fixie for the money. Very light and fast. Used it around town all summer and have had no issues. I had a few technical questions and the customer service was great. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick P Mangine

customer_reviews.title: The best bike purchase that I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: The best bike purchase that I have ever made, Assembly was quick and easy. I have been on a few rides and the bike is fast. My first ride I hit speeds of 18 mph. I purchased the 58cm bike and it fits me perfectly. I'm 6'2" and 250 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Pure Fix
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been commuting on this thing 4-5 days a week for 11 months now. It’s held up pretty well to abuse - the brakes are shoddy and the bottom bracket creaks, but for the money it’s been great.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This bike is awesome. It has a great paint job, the frame is sturdy and assembly was easy. I thought about giving 4 stars because I had to adjust the spokes to straighten out the wheels, but that was likely bent slightly during shipping. Overall runs well. I haven't used the fixie side of the wheel because I prefer a single speed bike in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Li Buessing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love my new fix. cant believe its so light weight
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Great looking bike
customer_reviews.text: Great looking bike. Was never interested in the brand names of components so this bike was the winner due its price. Money well spent I think.
customer_reviews.author: Darius DeBuhr

customer_reviews.title: Great deal, very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased with the bike. Delivered on time next day and was well packaged. Easy out of box assembly. Took it out for a test run immediately and had a great first, of hopefully many rides.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua K

product_meta.title: 6KU Aluminum Fixed Gear Single-Speed Fixie Urban Track Bike
product_meta.description: People asked for a solid, affordable track bike, so we delivered. The urban track features riser bars in place of drop bars for quick navigation through your city's concrete jungles. The lightweight 6061 alloy frame coupled with a matching 1 and 1/8″ alloy fork will offer you the best of both worlds. Use this bike for recreational commuting, or as an everyday means of transportation. This bike is jam-packed with features such as replaceable stainless steel dropouts, smooth welds, and high-quality aluminum. What are you waiting for choose your color, size and get on one today
feature_bullets: 32H F/R flip-flop hub for optional fixed or free wheel riding
30mm deep V double wall alloy wheels with a flip-flop hub
